title: Block-based UI Libraries for Data Flow?
description:
I’ve been chewing on some ideas around some different paradigms for code notebooks for a while and am wondering if any lobsters might be able to help me out. A couple of days ago I came across this interesting Simulink replacement: https://www.pictor.us. The ideas I’ve been chewing on don’t really fit into the Pictorus model at all, but they’ve absolutely nailed a couple of the UI pieces around wiring functional blocks together. GNUradio does too, sort of, but despite how much I love GR… I fully admit it’s kind of ugly. There’s a bunch of AV tools that do this too, but they’re very much based around sending audio data between blocks. Obsidian’s Canvas does a great job of the layout but doesn’t have any notion of data attached to the arrows between the blocks.

Does anyone have any suggestions for beautiful open-source libraries that let you do block-based data flow without being tied to a specific domain? I’m pretty agnostic to actual language or tech. I have a slight bias towards native desktop (OpenGL or whatever) but would be happy with browser-based as well, either through a Canvas or using real DOM elements.

[Apologies, not sure if I got the tags right here…]

How to share mouse, keyboard, and monitors between windows, macos, and Linux?
description:
I have my own business where I’m doing consulting with for various clients, and I’ve ended up with four different computers on my desk (personal desktop, personal/work laptop, client laptop #1, client laptop #2). I am trying to figure out how to cleanly share my peripherals with all the different computers.

I’ve tried:

  • software KVM (Synergy), but this doesn’t let me share the displays, and it’s very annoying to have to switch two monitor inputs anytime I want to change devices (not to mention my monitors don’t even have enough inputs to support all four devices)
  • hardware KVM: i bought a moderately expensive ($250) KVM switch that only supported 3 inputs, but it actually sorta worked…. Except for all the times it didn’t. My windows box was the most problematic, it REALLY doesn’t like having the keyboard and/or the displays yanked out from under it, and I routinely had to reboot multiple times to get it to pick everything up correctly.
  • remote desktop software: i thought this would actually be a good solution, but I’ve tried multiple different screen share/remote desktop solutions and none of them work. VNC (at least the one I was using) had extremely bad input lag, Microsoft remote desktop (seems to?) not work at all on macos, and other screen sharing applications (nomachine, anydesk, etc) work well except i can’t get the keyboard modifier keys consistent across all three platforms, which is a huge frustration and productivity hit for me.

I legitimately can’t think of any other options. I’ve investigated even more expensive hardware KVM switches, but I’m really hesitant to throw even more money down that rabbit hole when most things I read online indicate that they’re mediocre at best.

Does anybody else have this problem? Are there any solutions that I’m not thinking of? Should I just give up and buy some more external monitors? I’m really at a loss and I’ve also been staying up way too late bashing my head against this for a week now.
